WRITING.TITLE: Elevation profile from the "Te Araroa" - Download
WRITING.TEXT: Elevation profile according to the latest (1. October 2019) route data from [https://www.teararoa.org.nz/](https://www.teararoa.org.nz/).I didn't find a reliable source with the latest data, so I created it myself. Maybe it will help someone else. The splitted files are available as download here: [Elevation profiles as png](https://subject9223.ch/teararoa/elevation-profile-te-araroa-2019-2020/) Edit: Added elevation gain/loss to all sections [Full elevation profile Te Araroa](https://preview.redd.it/a55vfnn4kps31.png?width=3808 amp;format=png amp;auto=webp amp;s=f7d8e219d6e3cddddf29d57040ac0ba49fb65db4)
Good Point! Total elevation gain is 77,216 m, elevation loss is 77,328 m Once I have a little more time, I calculate the elevation gain/loss per splitted section and put it in the PNG's

WRITING.TITLE: Pretty nice camping spot found for my just created Cuben Poncho-Tarp

WRITING.TEXT: It's in Switzerland. Close to the "Eiger".

I constructed the "pattern" myself. Many things were only created ad-hoc. But I'm pretty happy with the result, although I would have used .8 cubes instead of 1.43. I was worried because it has to stay bombproof for my next thru-hike in NZ with very different weather. Once i have a little more time i will create a useable pattern and share it.
I use the SMD Net-tent. Works perfectly. But it shouldn't be much smaller. I am 6 foot. Ca. 10cm (4 inches) between outer and inner-tent. No condensation tontght with open hood during night.

Tooo heavy :(. It's 364 grams (13oz) with all the guylines etc.. Well it doubles as a Poncho so it's ok. Just a little bit disappointed because it's the same weight as my silnylon one (2nd Prototype before this). But of course was pretty obvious with this heavy-weight cuben version. I assume with .8 it would have been arround 260g (with guylines etc.).

That's true. The weight wasn't actually the primary reason to create a cuben version. It was more like the unbelievable water soaking from silnylon. When you have to use it as a poncho after a rainy night it's not really a pleasure to get into the soaked poncho-tarp in the morning. TBH i would rather have made it out of silpoly but i didn't find a sturdy enough version arround the same weight.

WRITING.TITLE: ITAP of a puffin in iceland

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for your feedback and the example of the crop. I am just an amateur photographer so feedback is always good.
Your boyfriend might be dissapointed. Even tough puffins look very similar to penguins. They aren't. puffins can fly. I think penguins can't (?).

I decided to do some hiking in northern Italy. This went on and on. Even the top of the mountain was trashed.
A hygrometer designed by Leonardo da Vinci

WRITING.TEXT: Leonardo made drawings of two different types of hygrometers, one with a quadrant structure, the other with a balance. The model represents the first of these devices for measuring the relative humidity of the air. On the quadrant hinges a bar, at the extremities of which a sponge and a block of wax are attached: one is impermeable (the wax), while the other is hygroscopic (absorbent: the sponge or cotton) and weighs more in accordance as the air is more humid, causing the balance pans to incline and the bar to move along the graduated quadrant.

WRITING.TITLE: I took this photo yesterday on a hike in Southern Iceland [OC][2048x1366]

WRITING.TEXT: Yes. It's a 5 day quarantine with two covid tests.
You could also go to Landmannalaugar and hike half a day up and down again. There is also a hot spring in Landmannalaugar.

Hi. It's like 2 hiking days after Porsmork direction Landmannalaugar. There is a dirt road going to Landmannalaugar which is most of the time suited for normal cars. A lot of people use 4x4 tour buses to do the hike. But as they stopped operating because of autum/winter I managed to get a lift with another traveller. It might also be pretty expensive with the 4x4 buses.
